metadata.Title: CVE-2023-30086 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability found in Libtiff V.4.0.7 allows a local attacker to cause a denial of service via the tiffcp function in tiffcp.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-30086` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6
libtiff-tools - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6
libtiff5 - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6
libtiffxx5 - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> it seems like this issue has the same fix as the one for CVE-2022-3599, which has already been patched in several releases as per USN-5714-1.

criterions.comment: tiff package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6').
